alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 1:31PM MDT until July 11 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...This includes areas where Santa Fe, Mora and San Miguel counties intersect. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, especially along Cave Creek. Increased water flows are expected in the Pecos River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cowles. - This includes the following highways... State Road 63 between Mile Markers 19 and 25.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
